intro: Stenothyrsus, commonly known as the golden club, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asparagaceae. It is characterized by its erect, grass-like appearance with narrow, strap-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or white in color. Stenothyrsus species are native to southern Africa and are often found in rocky or sandy soils. These plants are popular in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained conditions.
